articles.title: Apple Stock Trading 101 | Your Guide to Bull 2X & Bear 1X ETFs
articles.summary: This article introduces Direxion's Single Stock Daily Leveraged and Inverse ETFs for trading Apple (NASDAQ: AAPL) stock. It explains how these ETFs allow traders to capitalize on Apple's daily price movements, offering 200% leveraged bull or 100% inverse bear exposure. The article highlights that these tools are for traders who have a market view and are seeking higher risk opportunities.

articles.title: Casserole bowl to iPhone: How Steve Jobs started the partnership between Apple and Corning
articles.summary: This article details the historical partnership between Apple and Corning, tracing it back to the development of the original iPhone in 2007. It highlights how Steve Jobs, faced with a scratched iPhone prototype, challenged Corning to rapidly produce durable glass, leading to the creation of Gorilla Glass. The piece also notes Apple CEO Tim Cook's recent announcement about increasing investment in US manufacturing, with Corning's Kentucky facility producing glass for all new iPhones and Apple Watches.

articles.title: Apple, Corning to manufacture all iPhone, Apple Watch cover glass in Kentucky
articles.summary: Apple and Corning are expanding their partnership with a new $2.5 billion commitment from Apple to manufacture 100 percent of iPhone and Apple Watch cover glass in Corning’s Harrodsburg, Kentucky facility. This move marks the first time that all cover glass for these devices sold worldwide will be made in the U.S. and is part of Apple's broader plan to invest $600 billion in the U.S. economy over the next four years. The initiative will also establish an Apple-Corning Innovation Center and increase Corning's Kentucky workforce by 50 percent.

articles.title: Applied Materials Joins Apple and Texas Instruments in Strengthening U.S. Chip Manufacturing
articles.summary: Applied Materials is collaborating with Apple and Texas Instruments to enhance the semiconductor manufacturing supply chain in the United States. This involves supplying American-made chipmaking equipment from its Austin facility to TI's U.S. factories for Apple products and investing over $200 million in a new Arizona facility for critical semiconductor equipment components. These efforts build on Applied Materials' prior investments in its U.S. manufacturing infrastructure, aiming to strengthen domestic chip production and leadership.

articles.title: Finding the Spark at Long Beach’s New Electric Vehicle Development Campus
articles.summary: Ford has expanded its electric vehicle development efforts with a new two-building campus in Long Beach, California, which serves as the company's main design and innovation hub in Southern California. Ann Diep, a senior technical program manager, provides an inside look at the collaborative space and the team's mission to develop approachable and exciting next-generation EVs. The campus emphasizes simplicity, efficiency, and collaboration, drawing diverse talent and leveraging Ford's automotive expertise with tech startup agility.

articles.title: Is Trimble (NASDAQ:TRMB) A Risky Investment?
articles.summary: This article analyzes Trimble Inc.'s debt levels, noting its debt has significantly decreased from US$3.03b to US$1.39b over the last year, with net debt at US$1.10b. Despite substantial liabilities, the company's strong free cash flow generation (97% of EBIT) and healthy interest coverage suggest it can manage its debt responsibly. The analysis concludes that while debt brings some risk, Trimble's sensible approach and market capitalization of US$19.7b mitigate concerns about permanent capital loss.

articles.title: Qualcomm Q3 revenue up 10% as it expands into smart glasses and AI computers
articles.summary: Qualcomm's fiscal Q3 revenue increased by 10% to $10.4 billion, driven by growth in automotive, internet-connected segments, and smartphone chipset sales, as well as expansions into AI-backed personal computers and smart glasses. The company is actively diversifying into data center chips, including a $2.4 billion acquisition of Alphawave Semi and advanced discussions with a leading hyperscaler customer, aiming to reduce reliance on the smartphone market and capitalize on the AI boom. Qualcomm also faces the challenge of Apple increasingly using its own modem products but expects handset revenues to grow from Q3 to Q4.

articles.title: Perfect Corp. Reports Unaudited Financial Results for the Three Months and the Six Months Ended June 30, 2025
articles.summary: Perfect Corp. announced its unaudited financial results for the three and six months ended June 30, 2025, showing increased revenue driven by mobile app and web services subscriptions, particularly from generative AI features. While enterprise segment growth remains strategic, the B2C segment is the primary revenue driver. The company reaffirms its full-year 2025 revenue guidance of 13.0% to 14.5% year-over-year.

articles.title: Perfect Corp. Reports Unaudited Financial Results for the Three Months and the Six Months Ended June 30, 2025
articles.summary: Perfect Corp. (NYSE: PERF) announced its unaudited financial results for the three and six months ended June 30, 2025. The company reported increased revenue driven by mobile app and web services subscriptions, despite a decrease in net income for the three-month period and a slight decrease in adjusted net income for the six-month period. Perfect Corp. reiterated its full-year 2025 revenue guidance, projecting 13.0% to 14.5% year-over-year growth, emphasizing continued investment in generative AI and B2C app growth.

articles.title: Kilroy Realty Sells Bay Area Campus for $365M
articles.summary: Kilroy Realty has agreed to sell its Mathilda Campus, a three-building office and R&D complex in Sunnyvale, Calif., for $365 million. This transaction, set to close in late Q3, is one of Silicon Valley's largest this year and includes tenants like LinkedIn and Apple. The sale highlights a pickup in Silicon Valley office activity, with the region surpassing previous years' investment volumes in the first half of the year.

articles.title: Earnings Calendar (28.07.2025): Apple, Amazon, Meta Platforms, Microsoft
articles.summary: The article details the upcoming earnings reports from major tech companies Apple, Amazon, Meta Platforms, and Microsoft, set for July 28, 2025. This earnings season is crucial as Big Tech drives US stock market valuations, with investor focus intensified after reduced trade war risks. Beyond tech giants, earnings from Boeing, Procter & Gamble, Visa, and Mastercard will also be closely watched for insights into various market segments.

articles.title: Toast Guest Terms of Service
articles.summary: This document outlines the legal terms of service for guests using Toast's technology, software, and services, including mobile applications and online ordering platforms. It covers user responsibilities, data usage, payment processing, intellectual property, and dispute resolution through mandatory arbitration. The terms specify conditions for accessing and using Toast's services, emphasizing that interactions with merchants are the merchant's sole responsibility.

articles.title: What’s Next For Arista Networks Stock?
articles.summary: Arista Networks (NYSE: ANET) has become a highly influential technology company, despite not selling GPUs or building AI models. The article highlights Arista's strong Q2 results, propelled by a 40.3% net margin, 54% operating cash flow margin, and a robust balance sheet with $8.1 billion in cash and no debt. While the stock's valuation is high, its consistent performance and critical role in AI infrastructure underpin its position as a "hidden giant" in the tech sector.

articles.title: Trump demands resignation of Intel CEO over China ties
articles.summary: Former President Donald Trump has demanded the immediate resignation of Intel CEO Lip-Bu Tan, citing his alleged ties to China and calling him "highly conflicted." This demand comes amid Trump's broader pressure on the semiconductor industry, including a threat of a 100% tariff on imported chips, and follows concerns raised by Sen. Tom Cotton regarding Tan's investments in Chinese companies with links to the People's Liberation Army. Intel's stock dropped over 2% following the news, further complicating the company's efforts to catch up with competitors in the AI race.

articles.title: GlobalFoundries Expands Partnership with Apple to Advance Wireless Connectivity and Power Management, Reinforcing U.S. Chip Manufacturing Leadership
articles.summary: GlobalFoundries (GF) announced a deeper collaboration with Apple to advance semiconductor technologies and strengthen U.S. manufacturing. This partnership will accelerate GF's investments at its Malta, New York facility, emphasizing a shared commitment to U.S.-based innovation and production of power-efficient, AI-enabling technologies for mobile computing and intelligent devices. The agreement reinforces the long-standing partnership between GF and Apple, supporting the growth of U.S. semiconductor manufacturing.

articles.title: CuriosityStream Announces Dividend Amid Strong Revenue Growth
articles.summary: CuriosityStream announced a quarterly cash dividend of $0.08 per share, payable on September 19, 2025. The company reported a significant 53% year-over-year revenue increase to $19 million for Q2 2025, driven by successful AI partnerships and new service launches. This financial growth is further supported by record net income and EBITDA, alongside expanded distribution agreements, leading to a moderately positive outlook from TipRanks’ AI Analyst, Spark.

articles.title: Meta Just Paid $250M To Lure This 24-year-old AI Whiz Kid: A Strategic Move Or A Power Play?
articles.summary: Meta Platforms has reportedly invested $250 million to secure the talents of 24-year-old AI prodigy Matt Deitke, reflecting Meta's aggressive strategy in acquiring top AI talent. This significant recruitment, which followed an initial refusal of a lower offer, highlights Meta's commitment to AI with substantial capital expenditures. However, it also raises concerns about economic inequality and the concentration of power in AI development, stirring debate about whether this strategy will lead to sustainable success or exacerbate existing social issues.

articles.title: Bitget Daily Digest(8.8) | Trump Signs Executive Order Allowing 401(k) Crypto Investment; ETH Daily Transactions Hit 1.87 Million Near All-Time High; Pump.fun Establishes Glass Full Foundation
articles.summary: This Bitget Daily Digest highlights an executive order signed by President Trump allowing 401(k) retirement accounts to invest in digital assets, potentially unlocking significant capital for the crypto sector. It also notes that Ethereum daily transactions are nearing an all-time high and Pump.fun has established the Glass Full Foundation to inject liquidity into ecosystem tokens. The digest covers various other crypto news, including Cboe's filing to add staking to the VanEck Ethereum ETF and the resolution of the SEC vs. Ripple legal battle.

articles.title: Fed Rate-Cut Chorus Grows Louder: Could This Be A Breakout Moment For Growth ETFs?
articles.summary: Federal Reserve officials are increasingly signaling an upcoming interest rate-reducing cycle, which could catalyze a rally in growth-oriented ETFs. This move stands to benefit growth funds by lowering borrowing costs for companies and drawing investors towards equities from fixed-income instruments. Investors are now heavily betting on a September rate cut, with the upcoming CPI report being a crucial factor.

articles.title: Meta Just Paid $250M To Lure This 24-year-old AI Whiz Kid: A Strategic Move Or A Power Play?
articles.summary: Meta Platforms has reportedly made a significant investment of $250 million to recruit 24-year-old AI prodigy Matt Deitke, highlighting the company's aggressive strategy to acquire top AI talent. This move, while fueling innovation, also raises concerns about increasing economic inequality and the concentration of power within AI development as Meta simultaneously conducts layoffs. The long-term implications of this strategy on the tech industry and society remain to be seen.

articles.title: University of Michigan startup Ambiq goes public
articles.summary: University of Michigan startup Ambiq, co-founded by Professors David Blaauw, Dennis Sylvester, and alumnus Dr. Scott Hanson, recently went public on the New York Stock Exchange under the ticker symbol AMBQ. The company's ultra-efficient chips, developed from NSF-funded research, are used in wearables like Fitbit, Garmin, and Whoop, and Ambiq is now expanding its mission to run AI models on small devices. This move marks a significant achievement in commercializing research that began in a university lab, solving the power bottleneck for AI in various compact electronics.

articles.title: General Motors, Hyundai to develop vehicles together amid China EV competition
articles.summary: General Motors (GM.N) and Hyundai Motor (005380.KS) announced plans to co-develop five vehicles, including compact SUVs/cars/pickups, mid-sized pickups for Latin America, and an electric commercial van for North America, aiming to lower costs amidst intense competition from Chinese EV manufacturers. While the partnership seeks to create synergies and leverage each company's strengths, some analysts question its effectiveness in challenging the low-priced dominance of Chinese rivals in the EV market. This collaboration marks Hyundai Motor's first major vehicle development partnership and comes as other South Korean and U.S. firms are also forging alliances.
